TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit CryptographicOperations extends System.Object
public ref class CryptographicOperations abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides methods for use in working with cryptography to reduce the risk of side-channel information leakage.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool FixedTimeEquals (ReadOnlySpan<byte> left, ReadOnlySpan<byte> right);
.method public static hidebysig bool FixedTimeEquals(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> left, valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> right) cil managed
Public Shared Function FixedTimeEquals (left As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte), right As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte)) As Boolean
static member FixedTimeEquals : ReadOnlySpan<byte> * ReadOnlySpan<byte> -> bool
public: static bool FixedTimeEquals(ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> left, ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> right);

Docs.summary: Determines the equality of two byte sequences in an amount of time that depends on the length of the sequences, but not their values.
Docs.returns: if and have the same values for and the same contents; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method compares the contents from two buffers for equality in a way that doesn't leak timing information, making it ideal for use within cryptographic routines.
This method will short-circuit and return `false` only if `left` and `right` have different lengths.
Fixed-time behavior is guaranteed in all other cases, including when `left` and `right` reference the same address.

public static void ZeroMemory (Span<byte> buffer);
.method public static hidebysig void ZeroMemory(valuetype System.Span`1<unsigned int8> buffer) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ZeroMemory (buffer As Span(Of Byte))
static member ZeroMemory : Span<byte> -> unit
public: static void ZeroMemory(Span<System::Byte> buffer);

Docs.param: The buffer to fill with zeros.
Docs.summary: Fills the provided buffer with zeros.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method exists to future-proof against potential optimizations in the .NET runtime that could eliminate memory writes that aren't followed by memory reads. While the C and C++ compilers have similar optimizations, no such optimizations are planned at this time for .NET.
